intro: Dictamnus sessilis, commonly known as the sessile dictamnus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are often covered in a distinctive, fragrant resin that exudes when the plant is damaged. Dictamnus sessilis is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
